evidence: SNR is a simple but powerful way of expressing how strong the signal is relative to the noise.
triples.o: how strong the signal is relative to the noise

concepts.term: SNR is defined as the ratio of signal power to noise power.
If the SNR is 5 or 10 or higher, the signal stands out clearly above the noise

triples.evidence: SNR is a simple but powerful way of expressing how strong the signal is relative to the noise. Mathematically, it is defined as the ratio of signal power to noise power.
